Thanks Stephen for providing me the right path as you have been there and guided so many. Your articles are awesome but I am reading it many times to figure it out completely. One thing that confuses me while using async await and Task.Run is that

Coming from backgroundworker thread background, I run (beginWorkerAsync) it for long processes in my winform and when I need to update UI I call INVOKE, but if I have to update it to using async j/ await / Task.Run then I think I might do the following

1) Use Task.Run and then should I update UI from there using INVOKE? But if I use this approach is it not the same as backgroundworker with the only advantage I see here is might be less code or more readability?

2) I just can't think how async await fits in for my requirement because most of my code is CPU intensive and if I use it, it still runs on UI thread and hence freezes my UI

3) Is async await only useful for Network scenario, as far as keeping UI responsive is concerned?

Thanks.
